newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Caracas stocks end flat, waiting for news.
newsitem.headline: Caracas stocks end flat, waiting for news.

text.p: Caracas stocks closed broadly flat as a generally bullish market waited for further news before moving ahead again, traders and analysts said.
Bolsa bellwether Electricidad de Caracas, awaiting news of tariff increases, led trade at over six million shares, with demand high from foreign bidders, analysts added.
"It's cheap compared to other utilities in the region," Merinvest analyst Roberto Isasi said.
The market's 19-share index closed little changed at 6496.49 points as 31.5 million shares traded worth 5.3 billion bolivars ($11 million).
Merinvest's composite index, which includes telephone company CANTV, closed ahead 0.14 percent at 102.12 points.
Among traded titles 20 rose, 14 fell and six ended flat.
"Foreign investors are looking at Venezuela favorably," said Isasi.
